metadata.synopsis: Voss arrives at camp and attempts to sway Laezel to his side after the events of the Creche. The Avatar can push Laezel to either agree or stay true to herself, potentially putting her on her Orpheus path.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load Act2In Game, these startup params work best for me: -load GustavDev:SCL_Main_A -asserts 0In Game Shipping: -load GustavDev:SCL_Main_AMake sure Laezel is either Companion or AvatarIn Camp Debug Book (CTRL + SHIFT + 8 ) -> Queue Night -> NIGHT_Laezel_VossCampConfrontationLong RestGo to sleep

47.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The player wakes up in the middle of the night to find Kith'rak Voss there, accompanied by one other gith. Voss holds his sword in a seemingly aggressive manner.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: Supreme Kith'rak. Has Vlaakith sent you to slay me with your own blade?

48.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
48.text: I've not come to kill you, Lae'zel. I've come to aid you.
48.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

78.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
78.text: I've not come to kill you, Lae'zel. I've come to aid you.
78.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: Tl'a'Vlaakith - has our queen sent a knight to slay me with his own blade?

57.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
57.text: Such informality, child. Does Jhe'stil Kith'rak not command your respect?
57.context: NodeContext: zhe-STILL KITH-rack. Supreme Knight. Fatherly, but not antagonsistically like before.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: Your blade speaks for you, kith'rak. You've come for blood.

1.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
1.text: Child of Gith. I've not come to kill you. I've come to aid you.
1.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

14.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss kneels and lays his sword on the ground in the githyanki sign of submission.

61.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
61.text: Ska'kek kir Gith shabell'eth. My blade rests. Mother Gith compels you to listen.
61.context: NodeContext: Addressed to Lae'zel. SKA-kek keer gith shah-BELL-eth. 'The word of Gith be present'.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Your cronies tried to kill us. Why should Lae'zel listen to you?

65.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
65.text: I knew you would fight - and I knew you would win. I needed to ensure Vlaakith's trust. This was the only way.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Fine. We'll hear what you have to say before we gut you.

6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
6.text: Be at ease. I bring only truth.

33.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
33.text: I know you carry the Astral Prism, Lae'zel.

80.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
80.text: Within it lies the seed of Vlaakith's demise. And I intend to help you bring it to fruition.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: Vlaakith's demise? Shka'keth. I should run you through for suggesting it.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Are you talking about the person inside? Do you know who that is?

22.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
22.text: But the one inside's chosen you as an ally, protects you with their power.

59.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
59.text: That very power will be the end of Vlaakith's tyranny. The Prism's tenant must be let loose.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: What are you asking of us, Voss?

67.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
67.text: I'm asking for your help - and your trust.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You must be either a fool or a hero to work against your own queen.

49.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
49.text: A fool stumbles without cause. A hero serves a cause without question.

70.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
70.text: I am neither. 'Clear of heart, clear of mind, and bound by no master.' Now - you must listen.

19.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
19.text: The Prism's tenant can put an end to Vlaakith's tyranny. They must be let loose.

53.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
53.text: I've sought their freedom for aeons. When the Prism went missing, I feared the worst.

23.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
23.text: Instead, you've granted the opportunity I've so long awaited.

42.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
42.text: All that remains is the key that unchains them - and I've found someone who I believe can provide it.

41.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
41.text: Bring the Prism to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting in a taproom called Sharess' Caress. That is where we decide the fate of my people.

60.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
60.text: Lae'zel - together we will break our chains, and be Vlaakith's slaves no longer.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: I am no slave, Jhe'stil Kith'rak. The Undying Queen is my freedom. It is she who will purify me, and she who will ascend me.
3.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not too vehement. zhe-STIL KITH-rack.

58.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
58.text: Lies, Lae'zel - every last one. There is no purification, no ascension.

35.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
35.text: The zaith'isk does not purify - it extracts memory and kills the infected. Nor does the lich queen glorify the ascended. She feeds on most all of them to grow her power and pursue godhood.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Madness. You flood me with this... this heresy.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Posture in Lae'zel grows aggressive. She raises her blade.NodeContext: Not nearly as aggressive as usual. She believes him but is keeping up appearances.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: I... I will hear no more of it.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Posture in Lae'zel grows even more aggressive her blade is still raised.NodeContext: Rising alittle in anger but questioning. She is ready to be convinced. But she has to keep up appearances.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Who is the person inside the Prism?

2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
2.text: If they have not said, they must have good reason. And I won't be the one to betray them.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: He speaks true of the zaith'isk. You need to trust him.

54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel breathes in sharply, cloises her eyes, lowers her blade, and calms herself. Finally, she has seen through her Queen's lies.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: I served Vlaakith the whole of my life. Learned her words, fought her battles, yet she names me Hshar'lak. Your words carry truth.
32.context: NodeContext: Quietly but with rising determination and consideration. hshar'lak (h-SHAR-lahk) = traitor

13.speaker: Lae'zel
13.text: I will meet you in Baldur's Gate. Do not make me regret it.

62.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss takes his blade from the ground and rises.

74.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
74.text: Lae'zel. I see T'lak'ma Ghir in you - Sister in Freedom. Together, we will be our people's light.

15.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
15.text: Take this. It is a qua'nith - a psionic detector.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gives the psionic detectorNodeContext: QUAH-nith

51.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
51.text: The queen's warriors hunt you. The qua'nith will sound out when you come near their portals. Hear its cry, and prepare for battle - or slip away.

18.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
18.text: I should go. Vlaakith's gaze pierces the seas and skies. She believes me loyal - and I can't afford her mistrust.

29.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
29.text: Keep the Astral Prism close. Let no one take it from you. Slay any who try.

43.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
43.text: Now - to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting, Lae'zel.

72.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss and his companions wave their hands together, and a portal opens before them. They step through and the portals close behind them.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: I served Vlaakith the whole of my life. Learned her words, fought her battles. Yet your words carry truth.
34.context: NodeContext: Quietly but with rising determination and consideration

20.speaker: Player
20.text: What do you want to do Lae'zel? I have your back.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Vlaakith's led you astray. I believe him, and so should you.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Kill him. This is your chance to earn Vlaakith's redemption.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Yes. Yes! I am Vlaakith's will!

30.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss grabs his blade from the ground and gears up to attack.NodeContext: Heh-TAH-zith - Die, creature!

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I'm not giving you the Astral Prism, if that's what you're wanting.

68.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
68.text: I've heard word from Crèche Y'llek. You are infected - yet the one in the Prism has chosen you, protects you with their power.

66.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
66.text: The Prism's tenant alone has the power to end Vlaakith's tyranny.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Vlaakith is my queen. Why would I want to end her?

0.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
0.text: Because her throne rests on lies, more than a hundred gish scholars could count in a lifetime. I will share but two.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.context: NodeContext: Unsure of herself, not too vehement.

37.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
37.text: Your doubt does not make it any less true, child.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Nod to Lae'zel. She should take the lead.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Your queen hunts us. Why in the hells should we listen to you?

69.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
69.text: Because I know who you are, and I know about the Astral Prism.
